summary.raw:
Fixed bug causing integer labelling to malfunction due to the dataframe
not being updated prior to renumber_rows() being called

Made sure extra information in progress bar is visible by forcing repaing
when status changes.
summary.html:
Fixed bug causing integer labelling to malfunction due to the dataframe
not being updated prior to renumber_rows() being called

Made sure extra information in progress bar is visible by forcing repaing
when status changes.

values.message:
Fixed bug causing integer labelling to malfunction due to the dataframe
not being updated prior to renumber_rows() being called

Made sure extra information in progress bar is visible by forcing repaing
when status changes.

summary.raw:
Performance optimisation.

* lookup rows in dataframe by filepath using a dictionary cache rather
  than searching the dataframe. This removes the need for the method
  get_model_row_by_filepath(), so it has been removed and the dictionary used
  directly.

* Remove redundant getting of the row index again for the Qt model - it is
  the same row as the dataframe

* Avoid setting the text of a QStandardItem twice by only creating it once
  the text it should have is known

* Add an argument to renumber_rows() that allows it to only renumber recent
  rows for the case that new rows have been added and don't have numbers yet
  but the existing row numbers are still valid

* Modify batch processing of shot files to use a dynamic batch size, with
  larger batches the more shots lyse has loaded. This is a good tradeoff
  between GUI responsiveness when there are a small number of shot files
  and speed when loading a large number of shot files. The batch size is 1/3
  of the number of shots. Larger batch sizes mean less redundant concatenation
  of dataframes.

* Modify the progress bar message to say when it's reading shot files
  vs concatenating dataframes vs updating the filebox GUI.
summary.html:
Performance optimisation.

  • lookup rows in dataframe by filepath using a dictionary cache rather
    than searching the dataframe. This removes the need for the method
    get_model_row_by_filepath(), so it has been removed and the dictionary used
    directly.

  • Remove redundant getting of the row index again for the Qt model - it is
    the same row as the dataframe

  • Avoid setting the text of a QStandardItem twice by only creating it once
    the text it should have is known

  • Add an argument to renumber_rows() that allows it to only renumber recent
    rows for the case that new rows have been added and don't have numbers yet
    but the existing row numbers are still valid

  • Modify batch processing of shot files to use a dynamic batch size, with
    larger batches the more shots lyse has loaded. This is a good tradeoff
    between GUI responsiveness when there are a small number of shot files
    and speed when loading a large number of shot files. The batch size is 1/3
    of the number of shots. Larger batch sizes mean less redundant concatenation
    of dataframes.

  • Modify the progress bar message to say when it's reading shot files
    vs concatenating dataframes vs updating the filebox GUI.

values.message:
Performance optimisation.

* lookup rows in dataframe by filepath using a dictionary cache rather
  than searching the dataframe. This removes the need for the method
  get_model_row_by_filepath(), so it has been removed and the dictionary used
  directly.

* Remove redundant getting of the row index again for the Qt model - it is
  the same row as the dataframe

* Avoid setting the text of a QStandardItem twice by only creating it once
  the text it should have is known

* Add an argument to renumber_rows() that allows it to only renumber recent
  rows for the case that new rows have been added and don't have numbers yet
  but the existing row numbers are still valid

* Modify batch processing of shot files to use a dynamic batch size, with
  larger batches the more shots lyse has loaded. This is a good tradeoff
  between GUI responsiveness when there are a small number of shot files
  and speed when loading a large number of shot files. The batch size is 1/3
  of the number of shots. Larger batch sizes mean less redundant concatenation
  of dataframes.

* Modify the progress bar message to say when it's reading shot files
  vs concatenating dataframes vs updating the filebox GUI.
